w:r.w:t: QUEUESENSE — INTERACTIVE DEMO APP SPEC DOCUMENT
(Designed to be the input spec for an agentic AI builder)
Architecture: React SPA + Netlify Hosting + Configurable Env + Mocked Backend
QueueSense is a demonstration-only, production-styled application that visually showcases the experience described in the presentation deck ().
The goal is to simulate a fully functional SaaS platform with:
Polished UI (Apple-inspired: minimal, clean, white-space heavy)
Simulated login for both consumers and organizations
This is a presentation artifact, not a production system.
All data is mocked. All users and orgs are defined in .env.
“Make the judges feel like this product exists.”
The app must load all credentials, Netlify domain, and mock organization settings from an environment file (.env).
These values must be parsed at runtime.
Adding a new user must not require code changes.
Changing the Netlify domain must be a single .env update.
SF Pro–style fonts or equivalents (Inter/Poppins preferred)
Avoid clutter: show only what’s needed
Buttons must have subtle hover transforms
Notifications should slide in/out, not pop abruptly
These represent the screen-by-screen playbook for the agent to build.
Create the illusion of secure authentication.
Show instant value + mirror deck slide ().
Clicking a card → opens detail screen
Simulate a real predictive healthcare wait-time module.
“Alert me when under X minutes” toggle
DMV at lowest wait of the day
No backend — static list with timestamps.
SCREEN 6 — BUSINESS EFFICIENCY DASHBOARD (ADMIN HERO SCREEN)
Demonstrate the enterprise monetization engine visually.
Data Inputs → Analytics Engine → Predictive Modeling → Outputs (App + Dashboard)
